results.definition: an instance or single occasion for some event
examples: this time he succeeded
he called four times
he could do ten at a clip

results.definition: a period of time considered as a resource under your control and sufficient to accomplish something
examples: take time to smell the roses
I didn't have time to finish
it took more than half my time

results.definition: an indefinite period (usually marked by specific attributes or activities)
examples: he waited a long time
the time of year for planting
he was a great actor in his time
it is time to go

results.definition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
a person's experience on a particular occasion
examples: he had a time holding back the tears
they had a good time together

results.definition: a reading of a point in time as given by a clock
examples: do you know what time it is?
the time is 10 o'clock

results.definition: the fourth coordinate that is required (along with three spatial dimensions) to specify a physical event
rhythm as given by division into parts of equal duration
the period of time a prisoner is imprisoned
examples: he served a prison term of 15 months
his sentence was 5 to 10 years
he is doing time in the county jail

results.definition: measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
examples: he clocked the runners

results.definition: assign a time for an activity or event
examples: The candidate carefully timed his appearance at the disaster scene

results.definition: set the speed, duration, or execution of
examples: we time the process to manufacture our cars very precisely

results.definition: regulate or set the time of
examples: time the clock

results.definition: adjust so that a force is applied and an action occurs at the desired time
examples: The good player times his swing so as to hit the ball squarely
